required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study On An Immunostimulant Antibody In Combination With Chemotherapy For Advanced Cancer Of The Pancreas
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Dose Escalation Open Label Study Of CP-870,893 In Combination With Gemcitabine In Patients With Chemotherapy-Naïve Surgically Incurable Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to seek evidence that activation of certain cells of the immune system will be safe and well tolerated in combination with cytotoxic chemotherapy. Preliminary evidence of clinical anti-tumor activity will be sought.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
primary_outcome.description: Any of the following during first cycle of treatment and attributable to CP-870893: afebrile Grade (Gr) 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count [ANC] <500 cells/mm^3) ≥7 days or Gr 3 or 4 neutropenia associated with fever (1 oral temperature >38.5 degrees Celsius (C) or 3 oral temperatures >38.0 degrees C in a 24-hour period); Gr 4 thrombocytopenia or Gr 3 thrombocytopenia associated with bleeding; Gr 4 lymphopenia, if coupled with clinical consequence (such as, opportunistic infection) or any other Gr 3 hematological adverse events; ≥Gr 3 non-hematologic toxicities (except alopecia).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Tumor Response According to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of every even-numbered cycle (cycle=28 days) up to a maximum of 12 cycles and 4 to 6 weeks following initial documentation of response
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, assessed monthly until death or 7.5 months after last participant was enrolled (up to January 2011)
secondary_outcome.description: OS is time from baseline to death from any cause. Participants last known to be alive were censored at the date of last contact.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, assessed monthly until death or 7.5 months after last participant was enrolled (up to January 2011)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is time from baseline to first progression (Prog) or death from any cause. Participants last known to be alive, had not started a new (non-protocol) cancer treatment, were Prog-free, and who had a baseline and ≥1 on-study disease assessment were censored at date of last objective disease assessment that verified lack of Prog. Participants who were off treatment prior to Prog and who had no on-study disease assessment were also censored. Prog: ≥20% increase in sum of longest dimension (LD) of target lesions from smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Monthly until death or 7.5 months after last participant was enrolled (up to January 2011)
secondary_outcome.description: Disease progression defined as ≥20% increase in sum LD of target lesions from smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions. Criteria for progression also included unequivocal progression of existing nontarget lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 3 pre-dose, 5 minutes after End of Infusion (EOI), and 2, 6, and 24 hours after EOI and pre-dose on Day 3 of every subsequent cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 3 pre-dose, 5 minutes after EOI, and 2, 6, and 24 hours after EOI and pre-dose on Day 3 of every subsequent cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the serum concentration time-curve from time zero to the last measured concentration. AUClast analyzed using a noncompartmental approach to estimate individual participant values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change (Pre-dose to Post-dose) in Plasma Cytokine Concentrations: Pre-dose Concentration (CYTO0), Maximum Concentration (CTYOMAX)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 1 prior to gemcitabine infusion (0 hour), 5 minutes after EOI and 2, 4, 6, and 24 hours after EOI; Cycle 1 / Day 3 prior to CP-970893 infusion (0 hour), 5 minutes after EOI, and 2, 4, 6, and 24 hours after EOI
secondary_outcome.description: An increase in values indicates greater cytokine release from cells targeted by the antibody and may be associated with an infusion reaction. Change calculated as mean of pre-dose and maximum post-dose values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change (Pre-dose to Post-dose) in Plasma Cytokine Concentrations: Time of Maximum Concentration (TCYTOMAX)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 1 prior to gemcitabine infusion (0 hour), 5 minutes after EOI and 2, 4, 6, and 24 hours after EOI; Cycle 1 / Day 3 prior to CP-970893 infusion (0 hour), 5 minutes after EOI, and 2, 4, 6, and 24 hours after EOI
secondary_outcome.description: An increase in values indicates greater cytokine release from cells targeted by the antibody and may be associated with an infusion reaction. Change calculated as mean of pre-dose and maximum post-dose values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total and Neutralizing Human Antihuman Antibody (HAHA) Titer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to infusion of CP-870893 on Day 3 of every cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: HAHA assessed as an indicator of immunogenicity to CP-870893.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change (Pre-dose to Post-dose) in Bone Marrow Derived Cells (B Cell) Surface Markers: CD54, CD23, CD40, CD86, and Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA-DR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 1 and Cycle 1 / Day 8 prior to gemcitabine infusion and 6 and 24 hours after EOI; Cycle 1 / Day 3 prior to CP-870893 infusion and 6, 24, and 48 hours after EOI
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the ability of PF-870893 to activate B-cells and HLA-DR which are involved in the production of antibodies. Change calculated as mean of pre-dose and post-dose values. Positive values indicate greater presence of cells associated with antibody production.

secondary_outcome.measure: 18-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Imaging (MTD Expansion Cohort)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 2, Week 8, and Single Time Point (STP) PET for all PET scans after Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: FDG PET assessment to characterize and monitor tumors before and after study treatment; measured as a standardized uptake value (SUV). A reduction in SUV from baseline for at least 1 tumor may indicate a positive metabolic response to treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of every even-numbered cycle (cycle=28 days) and 4 to 6 weeks following initial documentation of response
secondary_outcome.description: CA 19-9 or sialylated Lewis (a) antigen (a tumor marker). Values higher than 37 units per milliliter (U/ml) considered abnormal; higher values usually indicate greater presence of disease.

other_outcome.measure: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) of CP-870893 in Participants With Advanced Pancreas Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to time of determination of maximum tolerated dose (MTD)
other_outcome.description: Additional participants enrolled at MTD of CP-870893 to further characterize suitability for phase 2 testing. RP2D confirmed if ≤ 3 our of 12 participants in expansion cohort experience DLT in cycle 1.

intervention.description: CP-870,893 intravenous administration [IV] on day 3 of 4-week cycles
gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 intravenous administration [IV] q week [wk]x3 of 4-week cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1st-line surgically incurable cancer of the pancreas
- ECOG(Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous systemic therapy for pancreas cancer
- History of cancer-associated blood clots
- History of autoimmune disease

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: pancreas cancer; cancer of the pancreas; gemcitabine; chemotherapy; monoclonal antibody; immunotherapy; CD40

group.title: CP-870893 0.1 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenously (IV) on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

group.title: CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg (Escalation Cohort)
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.1 mg/kg cohort experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

group.title: CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg (MTD Expansion Cohort)
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg cohort (escalation cohort) experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, 0.2 mg/kg was considered the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
outcome.description: Any of the following during first cycle of treatment and attributable to CP-870893: afebrile Grade (Gr) 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count [ANC] <500 cells/mm^3) ≥7 days or Gr 3 or 4 neutropenia associated with fever (1 oral temperature >38.5 degrees Celsius (C) or 3 oral temperatures >38.0 degrees C in a 24-hour period); Gr 4 thrombocytopenia or Gr 3 thrombocytopenia associated with bleeding; Gr 4 lymphopenia, if coupled with clinical consequence (such as, opportunistic infection) or any other Gr 3 hematological adverse events; ≥Gr 3 non-hematologic toxicities (except alopecia).
outcome.population: Safety population: all participants who received any study treatment. Cubic millimeters (mm^3).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
measure.description: Any of the following during first cycle of treatment and attributable to CP-870893: afebrile Grade (Gr) 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count [ANC] <500 cells/mm^3) ≥7 days or Gr 3 or 4 neutropenia associated with fever (1 oral temperature >38.5 degrees Celsius (C) or 3 oral temperatures >38.0 degrees C in a 24-hour period); Gr 4 thrombocytopenia or Gr 3 thrombocytopenia associated with bleeding; Gr 4 lymphopenia, if coupled with clinical consequence (such as, opportunistic infection) or any other Gr 3 hematological adverse events; ≥Gr 3 non-hematologic toxicities (except alopecia).
measure.population: Safety population: all participants who received any study treatment. Cubic millimeters (mm^3).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Tumor Response According to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.time_frame: At the end of every even-numbered cycle (cycle=28 days) up to a maximum of 12 cycles and 4 to 6 weeks following initial documentation of response
outcome.population: Safety population; Confidence Interval (CI) calculated using exact method based on binomial distribution.

group.title: CP-870893 0.1 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenously (IV) on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.1 mg/kg cohort experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg cohort (escalation cohort) experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, 0.2 mg/kg was considered the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Tumor Response According to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
measure.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
measure.population: Safety population; Confidence Interval (CI) calculated using exact method based on binomial distribution.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS is time from baseline to death from any cause. Participants last known to be alive were censored at the date of last contact.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, assessed monthly until death or 7.5 months after last participant was enrolled (up to January 2011)
outcome.population: Safety population; Kaplan-Meier estimate of time to event 95 percent confidence interval (95% CI) for 50% quartile based on Brookmeyer and Crowley Method.

group.title: CP-870893 Combined Dose Cohorts
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 mg/kg (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: OS is time from baseline to death from any cause. Participants last known to be alive were censored at the date of last contact.
measure.population: Safety population; Kaplan-Meier estimate of time to event 95 percent confidence interval (95% CI) for 50% quartile based on Brookmeyer and Crowley Method.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS is time from baseline to first progression (Prog) or death from any cause. Participants last known to be alive, had not started a new (non-protocol) cancer treatment, were Prog-free, and who had a baseline and ≥1 on-study disease assessment were censored at date of last objective disease assessment that verified lack of Prog. Participants who were off treatment prior to Prog and who had no on-study disease assessment were also censored. Prog: ≥20% increase in sum of longest dimension (LD) of target lesions from smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, assessed monthly until death or 7.5 months after last participant was enrolled (up to January 2011)
outcome.population: Safety population; Kaplan-Meier estimate of time to event 95% CI for 50% quartile based on Brookmeyer and Crowley Method. Criteria for progression also included unequivocal progression of existing nontarget lesions.

group.title: CP-870893 Combined Dose Cohorts
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 mg/kg (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS is time from baseline to first progression (Prog) or death from any cause. Participants last known to be alive, had not started a new (non-protocol) cancer treatment, were Prog-free, and who had a baseline and ≥1 on-study disease assessment were censored at date of last objective disease assessment that verified lack of Prog. Participants who were off treatment prior to Prog and who had no on-study disease assessment were also censored. Prog: ≥20% increase in sum of longest dimension (LD) of target lesions from smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions.
measure.population: Safety population; Kaplan-Meier estimate of time to event 95% CI for 50% quartile based on Brookmeyer and Crowley Method. Criteria for progression also included unequivocal progression of existing nontarget lesions.

outcome.title: Time to Progression
outcome.description: Disease progression defined as ≥20% increase in sum LD of target lesions from smallest sum LD recorded since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions. Criteria for progression also included unequivocal progression of existing nontarget lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Monthly until death or 7.5 months after last participant was enrolled (up to January 2011)
outcome.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

group.title: CP-870893 Combined Dose Cohorts
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. measure.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

outcome.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

group.title: CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg (Escalation Cohort)
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.1 mg/kg cohort experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

group.title: CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg (MTD Expansion Cohort)
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg cohort (escalation cohort) experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, 0.2 mg/kg was considered the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: Change (Pre-dose to Post-dose) in Plasma Cytokine Concentrations: Pre-dose Concentration (CYTO0), Maximum Concentration (CTYOMAX)
measure.description: An increase in values indicates greater cytokine release from cells targeted by the antibody and may be associated with an infusion reaction. Change calculated as mean of pre-dose and maximum post-dose values.
measure.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

outcome.title: Change (Pre-dose to Post-dose) in Plasma Cytokine Concentrations: Time of Maximum Concentration (TCYTOMAX)
outcome.description: An increase in values indicates greater cytokine release from cells targeted by the antibody and may be associated with an infusion reaction. Change calculated as mean of pre-dose and maximum post-dose values.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 1 prior to gemcitabine infusion (0 hour), 5 minutes after EOI and 2, 4, 6, and 24 hours after EOI; Cycle 1 / Day 3 prior to CP-970893 infusion (0 hour), 5 minutes after EOI, and 2, 4, 6, and 24 hours after EOI
outcome.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

measure.title: Total and Neutralizing Human Antihuman Antibody (HAHA) Titer

outcome.title: Change (Pre-dose to Post-dose) in Bone Marrow Derived Cells (B Cell) Surface Markers: CD54, CD23, CD40, CD86, and Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA-DR)
outcome.description: Assess the ability of PF-870893 to activate B-cells and HLA-DR which are involved in the production of antibodies. Change calculated as mean of pre-dose and post-dose values. Positive values indicate greater presence of cells associated with antibody production.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 / Day 1 and Cycle 1 / Day 8 prior to gemcitabine infusion and 6 and 24 hours after EOI; Cycle 1 / Day 3 prior to CP-870893 infusion and 6, 24, and 48 hours after EOI
outcome.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

outcome.title: 18-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Imaging (MTD Expansion Cohort)
outcome.description: FDG PET assessment to characterize and monitor tumors before and after study treatment; measured as a standardized uptake value (SUV). A reduction in SUV from baseline for at least 1 tumor may indicate a positive metabolic response to treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 2, Week 8, and Single Time Point (STP) PET for all PET scans after Week 8
outcome.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

group.title: CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg (MTD Expansion Cohort)
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. If 0 out of 3 or <2 out of 6 participants in the CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg cohort (escalation cohort) experienced a dose limiting toxicity in Cycle 1, 0.2 mg/kg was considered the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: 18-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Imaging (MTD Expansion Cohort)
measure.description: FDG PET assessment to characterize and monitor tumors before and after study treatment; measured as a standardized uptake value (SUV). A reduction in SUV from baseline for at least 1 tumor may indicate a positive metabolic response to treatment.
measure.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

outcome.title: Carbohydrate Antigen 19-9 (CA 19-9)
outcome.description: CA 19-9 or sialylated Lewis (a) antigen (a tumor marker). Values higher than 37 units per milliliter (U/ml) considered abnormal; higher values usually indicate greater presence of disease.
outcome.time_frame: At the end of every even-numbered cycle (cycle=28 days) and 4 to 6 weeks following initial documentation of response
outcome.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

group.title: CP-870893 0.1 mg/kg
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenously (IV) on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: Carbohydrate Antigen 19-9 (CA 19-9)
measure.description: CA 19-9 or sialylated Lewis (a) antigen (a tumor marker). Values higher than 37 units per milliliter (U/ml) considered abnormal; higher values usually indicate greater presence of disease.
measure.population: No analyses of these parameters were performed due to the Sponsor's decision to terminate clinical evaluation of CP-870893.

outcome.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) of CP-870893 in Participants With Advanced Pancreas Cancer
outcome.description: Additional participants enrolled at MTD of CP-870893 to further characterize suitability for phase 2 testing. RP2D confirmed if ≤ 3 our of 12 participants in expansion cohort experience DLT in cycle 1.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to time of determination of maximum tolerated dose (MTD)

group.title: CP-870893 Combined Dose Cohorts
group.description: Participants received chemotherapy (gemcitabine) with a starting dose of 1000 milligrams per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenously (IV) on Day 1, 8, and 15 of every 28 day cycle up to a maximum of 12 cycles. CP-870893 administered IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle with starting dose of 0.1 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) (0.1 mg/kg cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Subsequent participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg escalation cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles. Additional participants were enrolled in the 0.2 mg/kg dose cohort and received chemotherapy on Day 1, 8, and 15 or every 28 day cycle and CP-870893 0.2 mg/kg IV on Day 3 of every 28 day cycle (0.2 mg/kg MTD expansion cohort) for up to a maximum of 12 cycles.

measure.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) of CP-870893 in Participants With Advanced Pancreas Cancer
measure.description: Additional participants enrolled at MTD of CP-870893 to further characterize suitability for phase 2 testing. RP2D confirmed if ≤ 3 our of 12 participants in expansion cohort experience DLT in cycle 1.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment emergent adverse events were reported from the time of the first dose of study treatment up to 28 days after last dose of study treatment.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
